sub_topic: Probability of a certain type of educational outcome occurring in a school
message_1: An elementary school has a total of 300 students. If the probability of a student passing the final mathematics exam is 0.8, what is the expected number of students who will pass the exam at the end of the semester?
message_2:
To find the expected number of students who will pass the exam, we can multiply the total number of students by the probability of passing the exam.

Expected number of students passing = Total number of students × Probability of passing
Expected number of students passing = 300 × 0.8
Expected number of students passing = 240

So, the expected number of students who will pass the exam at the end of the semester is 240.
